Humans would have the ability to explore and live in underwater environments, opening up new frontiers for scientific discovery and technological innovation.
The development of underwater infrastructure, such as cities and transportation systems, could revolutionize the way we live and work.
Underwater agriculture could be a game-changer, allowing us to grow crops in previously inaccessible areas and potentially feeding a growing global population.
Humans could use their enhanced senses, such as the ability to see in infrared and ultraviolet, to explore and interact with underwater ecosystems in ways that are currently impossible.
The underwater environment could become a new frontier for space exploration, with humans using their newfound abilities to explore and potentially colonize other planets.
